data.title: Upper Chateaugay Lake
data.meta_description: Located in Clinton County, Upper Chateaugay Lake has good fishing opportunities.
data.text:
The lake runs north to south. It has an island in the center called Moffit Island. There are large weed beds and a big wetland on the south end of the lake. Private homes and cottages line the eastern shoreline.

Physical Features:

Elevation: 1309 feet

Area: 2594 acres

Shoreline Length: 18.3 miles

Length: 3.3 miles

Maximum Depth: 78 feet

Mean Depth: 33 feet

Maximum Width: 1.5 miles

County and Town: Clinton County, Town of Dannemora

Access:

There is a DEC boat launch off Route 374, five miles north of the Hamlet of Merrill. The launch has a hard surface ramp with parking for 25 cars and trailers. The launch is in the Chateaugay Narrows approximately one mile north of the lake. The Chateaugay Narrows are navigable.

For more information on this launch including Google Maps driving directions, visit the Boat Launch Sites for Clinton County page.

Accessible Features

From the Route 374 Parking Area, wheelchair accessible features include the:

Trailered boat launch with dock

Visit the DEC Accessible Recreation Destinations web page for additional accessible recreation opportunities.

Fish Species:

Lake trout, landlocked salmon, rainbow trout, smallmouth bass, northern pike, rainbow smelt, yellow perch, brown bullhead, pumpkinseed, and rock bass.

Regulations:
